Description: Amuletic string: apart from the large 'Petunculus' shell and a single damaged cylinder of green glazed steatite, the beads and amulets are of glazed composition. The three moulded beads with spiral decoration are of blue-green glazed composition. The long cylindrical beads of uneven lengths and roughly broken at the ends are blue, green and dark-purple. There are two green oblate beads, a single dark-green very long truncated convex bicone and a dark-green barrel. The two amulets, one of green glazed composition, the other of blue with a knob of green, are virtually unidentifiable.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Mostagedda, Grave 1412 A child's burial.
Curator's comments: Brunton calls similar amulets greyhounds (G. Brunton, 'Qau and Badari' II (London, 1927-30), Bead corpusm pl. XCV, 16N9. Also from this burial: beads and pebble (1929,1015.533). Bibliography: G. Brunton, ‘Mostagedda and the Tasian Culture’ (London, 1937), Tomb register, pl.XLV; Bead register, pl.XLIX; Bead corpus, pl.LVIII, 76L2; 78M10.
Bibliographic references: Andrews 1981 / Catalogue of Egyptian Antiquities. Jewellery I (210)
